content:
Non-standard shifts are shifts not sought by contact center agents for various reasons. Identifying and marking shifts as non-standard helps the planner assign shifts in a more equitable way, reducing agent dissatisfaction and attrition.

Workforce Engagement is available in Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited Editions. Shift Scheduling is available in Contact Center SKU, Einstein 1 Service Edition, and Service Suites.

To create or apply a shift template: Shift Scheduling Planner or Workforce Engagement Planner permission is required.

Marking shifts as non-standard involves selecting the Non-Standard checkbox when creating or editing a shift. Marking a shift template as non-standard also requires this checkbox.

Non-standard shifts are flagged in views, such as schedule and table views. Planners can restrict how many non-standard shifts are assigned to each agent by setting a maximum number of non-standard shifts per scheduling constraint, rule, or resource.
title: Service Cloud Shift Scheduling
